title: Sri Lanka seeking to enhance country’s international reputation by co-hosting T20 World Cup
byline: Co-hosting the 2026 Twenty20 World Cup is expected to yield numerous advantages, such as enhancing the country’s international reputation and increasing the arrival of foreign tourists, the President’s Media Division stated.

title: Very heavy showers above 150 mm likely in some places today
byline: The low-pressure area over the southwest Bay of Bengal was located south of Sri Lanka at around last midnight (November 25).

title: UN begins process to elect next Secretary-General
byline: The search for the next Secretary-General of the United Nations launched Tuesday, as member states were invited to send nominations to replace Antonio Guterres for the term starting in 2027.

title: UN chief calls for end to unlawful occupation of Palestinian territory
byline: Statehood for the Palestinians is a right, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said Tuesday, while reiterating the call for an end to the unlawful occupation of the Palestinian territory.

title: Proposal presented to halt night-time train operations in areas where wild elephants roam
byline: A proposal has been submitted to authorities to operate night mail trains during the daytime in areas where wild elephants roam frequently, the Sri Lanka Railway Station Masters’ Association (SLRSMU) has stated.

title: Ports Authority to provide Rs. 5 billion to the Treasury
byline: The Sri Lanka Ports Authority is expected to provide Rs. 5 billion of its profit to the Consolidated Fund.

title: Budget 2026: Expenditure heads of Ministries of Industry, Science and Technology and Digital Economy to be debated today
byline: The expenditure heads of the Industry and Entrepreneurship Development, Ministry of Science and Technology and Ministry of Digital Economy are scheduled to be debated in Parliament today (26).

title: Very heavy showers above 150 mm likely in some areas today
byline: The low-pressure area over the southwest Bay of Bengal was located south of Sri Lanka at around last midnight (November 25).

title: Central Bank decides to keep policy rate unchanged
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has decided to maintain the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) at 7.75%, following its latest Monetary Policy Board meeting held yesterday (25).

title: Level 3 (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to areas in Kandy and Nuwara Eliya
byline: A ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning has been issued for multiple areas in the Kandy and Nuwara Eliya districts by the National Building and Research Organisation.

title: Microfinance and Credit Regulatory Authority Bill presented to Parliament
byline: The Microfinance and Credit Regulatory Authority Bill, which provides provisions to establish the Microfinance and Credit Regulatory Authority of Sri Lanka has been presented in Parliament.

title: Fine imposed on popular supermarket for selling rice above controlled price
byline: The management of a well-known supermarket in the Ratnapura town has admitted to selling locally produced Samba Red Raw Rice at prices higher than the government-controlled price.

title: Youth dies after boat capsizes in Kalpitiya
byline: A youth has died in an accident caused by a boat capsizing in Palakudawa, Kalpitiya, police stated.

title: HP to cut thousands of jobs due to AI adoption
byline: Computer and printer maker HP announced Tuesday (Nov 25) a sweeping restructuring plan that will eliminate about 10 per cent of its workforce globally as the company pivots toward artificial intelligence to boost efficiency.

title: UN AIDS body says Trump’s foreign aid cuts have killed people and left millions without medicine
byline: An uncounted number of extra people have died from AIDS and 2.5 million have lost access to antiretroviral medicine to block the spread of HIV because of cuts to global programs since Donald Trump returned to the White House, the UN body fighting AIDS says.

title: Three arrested at BIA with cigarettes valued at over Rs. 17 mln
byline: Three individuals have been arrested by Police officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake along with a stock of foreign-manufactured cigarettes valued at Rs. 17,850,000.

title: All fishermen urged not to venture into sea due to adverse weather conditions
byline: All fishermen have been advised not to venture into the sea until further notice due to hazardous and adverse weather conditions in the Bay of Bengal region, the Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources has announced.

title: One lane of Kandy-Colombo road at Pahala Kadugannawa reopened for traffic - RDA
byline: One lane of the Kandy-Colombo main road near Pahala Kadugannawa has been reopened, the Road Development Authority (RDA) has announced.

title: Amid H-1B visa debate, Trump administration’s call to “prioritize qualified Americans”
byline: The Donald Trump administration has pledged to ensure employers in the United States follow H-1B visa rules and “prioritise qualified Americans” over foreign workers in yet another crackdown on immigration.

title: Sri Lankan student in Bengaluru blackmailed after video call by ‘Instagram friend’
byline: A 24-year-old Sri Lankan national in Bengaluru has fallen victim to an online sextortion racket involving an unidentified individual who first contacted him through Instagram.

title: Over 365,000 individuals currently unemployed in Sri Lanka – PM
byline: A total of 365,951 individuals are currently unemployed in Sri Lanka, according to Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Former NPP Peliyagoda councillor’s husband further remanded
byline: The former National People’s Power (NPP) Peliyagoda Urban Councillor’s husband, who was arrested in Anuradhapura for the possession of heroin and subsequently suspended from his position as a school principal in Eppawala, has been further remanded.

title: Flood warning issued as Senanayaka Samudraya water levels reach peak
byline: The Department of Irrigation has issued a ‘Red’ flood warning for the downstream areas of the Gal Oya.

title: Train services on upcountry line restricted due to adverse weather conditions
byline: Train services along the upcountry line have been restricted owing to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Indian Navy’s indigenous aircraft carrier INS Vikrant arrives in Colombo
byline: The Indian Navy’s indigenous aircraft carrier INS Vikrant has arrived at Colombo Harbour today.

title: Budget 2026: Ministries of Industry, Science and Technology and Digital Economy allocations to be debated today
byline: The expenditure heads of the Industry and Entrepreneurship Development, Ministry of Science and Technology and Ministry of Digital Economy are scheduled to be debated in Parliament today (26).

title: Fishermen urged not to venture into sea due to adverse weather conditions
byline: All fishermen have been advised not to venture into the sea until further notice due to hazardous and adverse weather conditions in the Bay of Bengal region, the Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources has announced.

title: One spouse is enough, Vatican tells world’s Catholics
byline: Happily ever after doesn’t require any complicated maths, the Vatican said on Tuesday -- for Catholics, one spouse is enough.

title: Higher Education Commission to regulate and monitor private universities proposed
byline: The pressing need to establish a Higher Education Commission to regulate and monitor private universities and other degree-awarding institutions in the country has been emphasized during a meeting of the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Education, Manpower and Human Capital.

title: Woman remanded over death of stray dog in hit-and-run incident
byline: A woman allegedly involved in a hit-and-run incident involving a street dog in Pannipitiya has been remanded until December 9.

title: Apple set to become world’s top phone maker, overtaking Samsung
byline: Apple Inc. will retake its crown as the world’s largest smartphone maker for the first time in more than a decade, lifted by the successful debut of a new iPhone series and a rush of consumers upgrading devices, according to Counterpoint Research.

title: Flood warning issued as Senanayake Samudraya water levels reach peak
byline: The Department of Irrigation has issued a ‘Red’ flood warning for the downstream areas of the Gal Oya.

title: Thai court issues arrest warrant for Miss Universe co-owner
byline: A Thai court has issued an arrest warrant for the media mogul co-owner of the Miss Universe beauty pageant over alleged fraud worth US$930,000, a court official told AFP on Wednesday (Nov 26).

title: More details uncovered on murder of Chairman of Modara Devalaya committee
byline: The Galle Crime Investigation Division has arrested the main suspect in the murder of the brother-in-law of the criminal ‘Karandeniya Sudda’, who served as the Chairman of the Modara Devalaya Committee in Ambalangoda.

title: Landslides and flash floods on Indonesia’s Sumatra island leave at least 10 dead and 6 missing
byline: Torrential rains unleashed flash floods and triggered landslides on Indonesia’s Sumatra island, killing at least 10 people and leaving six others missing, police said Wednesday (Nov 26).

title: Fire rages through Hong Kong high-rise, leaving 4 dead
byline: Four people have been killed by a raging fire at a high-rise Hong Kong housing complex on Wednesday that left others trapped inside, authorities said.

title: Five fishing trawlers of narcotics dealer ‘Dehi Bale’ seized by CID
byline: A total of five fishing trawlers reportedly belonging to large-scale drug trafficker Sehan Sathsara alias ‘Dehi Bale’ have been seized.

title: Uber, WeRide launch driverless robotaxis in Abu Dhabi
byline: Uber Technologies rolled out driverless robotaxis in Abu Dhabi in partnership with Chinese autonomous-driving firm WeRide on Wednesday, following the tie-up they announced last year.

title: Flood warning issued for low-lying areas in Mahaweli River Basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has issued a warning of a potential flood situation within the next 48 hours in several areas surrounding the Mahaweli River Basin.

title: Jakarta overtakes Tokyo as world’s largest city, according to UN
byline: Indonesia’s capital, Jakarta, is the world’s largest urban centre with a population of almost 42 million, according to new research by the United Nations.

title: Spill gates of Weheragala reservoir opened, pilgrims visiting Kataragama urged to remain vigilant
byline: Spill gates of the Weheragala reservoir have been opened following heavy rainfall in the Monaragala district.

title: Flood warning issued for low-lying areas in Heda Oya Basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has issued a warning of a potential flood situation in low-lying areas along Heda Oya, for a period of 48 hours from 3.30 pm today (26).

title: Road leading to Somawathiya Chaitya closed due to floods
byline: The Polonnaruwa District Disaster Management Unit has closed the Somawathiya-Sungavila main road from 4.00 p.m. today (26) due to inundation following the overflowing of the Mahaweli River caused by the prevailing heavy rainfall experienced in the Polonnaruwa District.

title: UNP announces full support for Sajith’s decision
byline: The United National Party (UNP) states that it fully supports the decision taken by Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa to take on the responsibility of merging the United National Party (UNP) and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB).

title: Discussions on introducing first-ever guaranteed price for maize
byline: Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation K. D. Lalkantha stated that the government will consider farmers’ proposals on introducing a guaranteed price for maize based on production costs, government intervention in purchasing harvests and establishing an appropriate mechanism for the process.

title: LC openings drop as pent-up demand for vehicle imports declines – CBSL chief
byline: Sri Lanka’s Central Bank Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe says that a large number of Letters of Credit (LCs) were opened this year due to “pent-up demand” following the lifting of vehicle import restrictions in February and that the demand for vehicle imports is expected to stabilize in coming months.

title: Death toll in Hong Kong apartment complex fire rises to 13
byline: A fire spread across multiple high-rise apartment buildings in a Hong Kong housing complex on Wednesday, killing 13 people and leaving others trapped inside, authorities said.

title: Grace Richardson makes history as first openly gay Miss England
byline: 20-year-old student Grace Richardson made history when she became the first openly gay Miss England over the weekend.

title: Ex-SJB councillor and 6 others remanded over Tangalle narcotics seizure
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (26) ordered that seven suspects arrested in connection with the smuggling of nearly 376 kilograms of heroin and crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as “Ice”) into Sri Lanka off the coast of Tangalle, be remanded until December 09.

title: Flood warning issued for low-lying areas in Kumbukkan Oya Basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has issued a warning of a potential flood situation in low-lying areas along Kumbukkan Oya Basin.

title: Flood warning extended for low-lying areas of Deduru Oya Basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has has extended the warning issued for a potential flood situation in low-lying areas along Deduru Oya Basin for a further 48 hours.

title: Colombo-Badulla trains to terminate at Nanu Oya
byline: The Railway Department says that all upcountry train services between Colombo Fort and Badulla will terminate at Nanu Oya railway station until further notice, due to prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Colombo-Kandy road temporary closed from Pahala Kadugannawa
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) announced that the Colombo-Kandy main road will be temporarily closed from the Pahala Kadugannawa area starting from 10.00 p.m. tonight (26), until further notice.

title: Sri Lankan film industry recorded highest-ever revenue in history in 2025 - Producers
byline: The President stated that the advancement of cinema contributes to the spiritual and cultural development of a country’s citizens and that while safeguarding the domestic film industry, Sri Lankan audiences must be given the opportunity to watch international film productions.

title: Muslim schools in Eastern Province closed until further notice
byline: All Muslim schools within the Eastern Province will be closed from tomorrow (Thursday) until further notice due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions, the Eastern Province Governor Prof. Jayantha Lal Ratnasekera announced.
